00017   struct RecList
00018   {
00019     virtual void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id) = 0;

00022     static std::string toLower (const std::string& name)
00023     {
00024         std::string lowerCase;
00025 
00026         std::transform (name.begin(), name.end(), std::back_inserter (lowerCase),
00027             (int(*)(int)) std::tolower);
00028 
00029         return lowerCase;
00030     }
00031   };

00035   template <typename X>
00036   struct RecListT : RecList
00037   {
00038     typedef std::map<std::string,X> MapType;
00039 
00040     MapType list;
00041 
00042     // Load one object of this type
00043     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00044     {
00045       std::string id2 = toLower (id);
00046       list[id2].load(esm);
00047     }
00048 
00049     // Find the given object ID, or return NULL if not found.
00050     const X* search(const std::string &id) const
00051     {
00052       std::string id2 = toLower (id);
00053       if(list.find(id2) == list.end())
00054         return NULL;
00055       return &list.find(id2)->second;
00056     }
00057 
00058     // Find the given object ID (throws an exception if not found)
00059     const X* find(const std::string &id) const
00060     {
00061         const X *object = search (id);
00062 
00063         if (!object)
00064             throw std::runtime_error ("object " + id + " not found");
00065 
00066         return object;
00067     }
00068 
00069     int getSize() { return list.size(); }
00070   };

00152   // Cells aren't simply indexed by name. Exterior cells are treated
00153   // separately.
00154   // TODO: case handling (cell names are case-insensitive, but they are also showen to the
00155   // player, so we can't simply smash case.
00156   struct CellList : RecList
00157   {
00158     // Total cell count. Used for statistics.
00159     int count;
00160     CellList() : count(0) {}
00161     int getSize() { return count; }
00162 
00163     // List of interior cells. Indexed by cell name.
00164     typedef std::map<std::string,Cell*> IntCells;
00165     IntCells intCells;
00166 
00167     // List of exterior cells. Indexed as extCells[gridX][gridY].
00168     typedef std::map<int, Cell*> ExtCellsCol;
00169     typedef std::map<int, ExtCellsCol> ExtCells;
00170     ExtCells extCells;
00171 
00172     ~CellList()
00173     {
00174       for (IntCells::iterator it = intCells.begin(); it!=intCells.end(); ++it)
00175         delete it->second;
00176 
00177       for (ExtCells::iterator it = extCells.begin(); it!=extCells.end(); ++it)
00178       {
00179         ExtCellsCol& col = it->second;
00180         for (ExtCellsCol::iterator it = col.begin(); it!=col.end(); ++it)
00181         {
00182           delete it->second;
00183         }
00184       }
00185     }
00186 
00187     const Cell* findInt(const std::string &id) const
00188     {
00189       IntCells::const_iterator it = intCells.find(id);
00190 
00191       if(it == intCells.end())
00192         return NULL;
00193 
00194       return it->second;
00195     }
00196 
00197     const Cell *searchExt (int x, int y) const
00198     {
00199         ExtCells::const_iterator it = extCells.find (x);
00200 
00201         if (it==extCells.end())
00202             return 0;
00203 
00204         ExtCellsCol::const_iterator it2 = it->second.find (y);
00205 
00206         if (it2 == it->second.end())
00207             return 0;
00208 
00209         return it2->second;
00210     }
00211 
00212     const Cell *searchExtByName (const std::string& id) const
00213     {
00214         for (ExtCells::const_iterator iter = extCells.begin(); iter!=extCells.end(); ++iter)
00215         {
00216             const ExtCellsCol& column = iter->second;
00217             for (ExtCellsCol::const_iterator iter = column.begin(); iter!=column.end(); ++iter)
00218             {
00219                 if (iter->second->name==id)
00220                     return iter->second;
00221             }
00222         }
00223 
00224         return 0;
00225     }
00226 
00227     const Cell *searchExtByRegion (const std::string& id) const
00228     {
00229         std::string id2 = toLower (id);
00230 
00231         for (ExtCells::const_iterator iter = extCells.begin(); iter!=extCells.end(); ++iter)
00232         {
00233             const ExtCellsCol& column = iter->second;
00234             for (ExtCellsCol::const_iterator iter = column.begin(); iter!=column.end(); ++iter)
00235             {
00236                 if (toLower (iter->second->region)==id)
00237                     return iter->second;
00238             }
00239         }
00240 
00241         return 0;
00242     }
00243 
00244     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00245     {
00246       using namespace std;
00247 
00248       count++;
00249 
00250       // All cells have a name record, even nameless exterior cells.
00251       Cell *cell = new Cell;
00252       cell->name = id;
00253 
00254       // The cell itself takes care of all the hairy details
00255       cell->load(esm);
00256 
00257       if(cell->data.flags & Cell::Interior)
00258         {
00259           // Store interior cell by name
00260           intCells[id] = cell;
00261         }
00262       else
00263         {
00264           // Store exterior cells by grid position
00265           extCells[cell->data.gridX][cell->data.gridY] = cell;
00266         }
00267     }
00268   };

00270   template <typename X>
00271   struct ScriptListT : RecList
00272   {
00273     typedef std::map<std::string,X> MapType;
00274 
00275     MapType list;
00276 
00277     // Load one object of this type
00278     void load(ESMReader &esm, const std::string &id)
00279     {
00280       X ref;
00281       ref.load (esm);
00282 
00283       std::string realId = toLower (ref.data.name.toString());
00284 
00285       std::swap (list[realId], ref);
00286     }
00287 
00288     // Find the given object ID, or return NULL if not found.
00289     const X* search(const std::string &id) const
00290     {
00291       std::string id2 = toLower (id);
00292       if(list.find(id2) == list.end())
00293         return NULL;
00294       return &list.find(id2)->second;
00295     }
00296 
00297     // Find the given object ID (throws an exception if not found)
00298     const X* find(const std::string &id) const
00299     {
00300         const X *object = search (id);
00301 
00302         if (!object)
00303             throw std::runtime_error ("object " + id + " not found");
00304 
00305         return object;
00306     }
00307 
00308     int getSize() { return list.size(); }
00309   };
